maml:description.maml:para: Enumerates items from the pipeline.
Enumerates items from the pipeline.
The input object.
The starting index.
the value that will be added to the current index each iteration.
The input object.
The starting index.
the value that will be added to the current index each iteration.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
"a".."e" | Add-Index
Index Value ----- ----- 0 a 1 b 2 c 3 d 4 e

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example enumerates letters from 'a' to 'e'.

maml:description.maml:para: Appends items at the end of the pipeline.
Adds items at the end of the pipeline. The values can be generated by a script block, in which case the script block is called once at the end of the pipeline and its values are yielded.
A script block that yields values. Will be called after the pipe is depleted.
The input object.
A collection of objects to chain at the end of this pipe.
The input object.
The input object.
A script block that yields values. Will be called after the pipe is depleted.
A collection of objects to chain at the end of this pipe.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example appends numbers from 5 to 1 to the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Joins items from the pipeline with values from another collection or script.
Joins items from the pipeline with values from a collection or a script block.
If the script block parameter is used, the script will have the $_ automatic variable set to the current pipeline object and the value it yields will be used as the right value.
A script block with access to the pipeline ($_) that will yield a value.
The input object.
A collection to join with the current pipe.
The input object.
The input object.
A script block with access to the pipeline ($_) that will yield a value.
A collection to join with the current pipe.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example generates the squares of the numbers from 1 to 5.

maml:description.maml:para: Calculates the number of items in the pipeline, ignoring their values.
Calculates the number of items in the pipeline, ignoring their values.
The object frmo pipeline.
A collection of items to count.
The object frmo pipeline.
A collection of items to count.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example counts the number of items in the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Applies a reducing operation to every item in the pipeline, yielding a single value.
Applies an operation to each item in the pipeline, reducing it down to a single value. This is the equivalent of a flatmap / fold.
The script block gets to access the pipeline item with the $ variable and the result of the previous call as $ _ (also set as $args[0])
A script block that takes 1 argument (the last item calculated) and the access to the pipeline ($_).
An optional initial value.
The input object.
An optional initial value.
The input object.
A script block that takes 1 argument (the last item calculated) and the access to the pipeline ($_).

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example calculates the factorial of 5.

maml:description.maml:para: Skips items from the pipeline.
Skips items from the pipeline.
How many items to skip.
The input object.
Skip last N items instead.
Skip items while this script block evaluates to true.
The input object.
The input object.
Skip last N items instead.
How many items to skip.
Skip items while this script block evaluates to true.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first example skips first 5 items from the pipeline. The second example skips items from the pipeline while the script block evaluates to $true.

maml:description.maml:para: Alternates between the pipeline and a collection.
Alternates between the pipeline and a collection.
A collection to alternate with.
Discard leftover items if left or right are drained before the other.
The input object.
How many items to take from the left pipe in each alternation.
How many items to take from the right collection in each alternation.
Discard leftover items if left or right are drained before the other.
The input object.
How many items to take from the left pipe in each alternation.
How many items to take from the right collection in each alternation.
A collection to alternate with.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $left = "left 1", "left 2", "left 3" $right = "right 1", "right 2", "right 3" $left | Switch-Pipe $right left 1 right 1 left 2 right 2 left 3 right 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example alternates between the left items and the right items.

maml:description.maml:para: Takes items from the pipeline.
Takes items from the pipeline, ignoring the rest. This is the opposite of Skip-Item.
How many items to take.
The input from the pipeline.
Take last N items instead.
Take items while this script block evaluates to true.
The input from the pipeline.
The input from the pipeline.
Take last N items instead.
How many items to take.
Take items while this script block evaluates to true.

dev:remarks.maml:para: These two examples take the last 3 and first 3 items from the pipeline, respectively.
